name: Silent Crier
description: A medium-sized fiend that appears as an ominous presence, focused on psychological and area control during combat.
memorable: Possesses unique abilities like the Bell Toll that disrupts battlefield dynamics and instills fear.
goals: To control the battlefield, instill fear in enemies, and protect its territory through psychological tactics.
relations: Could be found alongside other fiends or dark creatures, possibly serving a greater evil entity.
environment: Often encountered in dark, eerie locations where it can leverage its psychological tactics.
strengths: Has damage resistances to cold, fire, lightning, and psychic attacks along with several condition immunities.
weaknesses: Limited mobility with a walking speed of only 30 feet, potentially restricting its positioning in combat.
attacks: Utilizes Mega Slam attacks combined with its Bell Toll abilities to deal damage and control enemies in area.
most_powerful_ability: Bell Toll, which can stun, damage, deafen, or frighten groups of enemies within its range.
senses: Has blindsight extending 120 feet, allowing it to detect creatures without relying on sight.
skills: Displays a keen awareness with a perception skill of +4.
additional_information: Immunity to being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, and poisoned.
Can perform a Multiattack with both Slam attacks and Bell Toll in the same turn.
Has a haunting presence with abilities like Endless Ringing that disrupt verbal spellcasting.
Broken Silence ensures Bell Toll effects impact all creatures, regardless of hearing status.
Thrives in dark environments where it can invoke fear and control its foes.
test_queries: fiend with fear and control abilities
monster that disrupts spellcasting with sound
creature that stuns enemies with a bell
psychological monster with area control tactics
